intro: Carpinus betulus f. aureovariegata, commonly known as the golden-leaved hornbeam, is a decorative variant of the common hornbeam. It is characterized by its striking variegated leaves that display a mix of yellow, white, and green, creating a striking visual effect. The plant is a deciduous tree or shrub, typically growing to a height of 6–10 meters. It thrives in well-drained soils and partial to full sun, making it suitable for gardens and urban landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its unique foliage, which provides seasonal interest throughout the year.
